project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I'm using JIRA Service Desk Application v3.2.4 / JIRA v7.2.4
Can we customized a web service to resolve duplicates automatically.
fields.summary: Automatic link and resolve | Support entitlement number (SEN)  - SEN-8815541

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Many of our teams have members working in different time zones but would like to plan using a single scrum/kanban board.

Some have expressed interest in being able to control workdays and holidays, as well as time zones in relation to the iteration start/stop times.

 

Since the teams operate in at least 2 time zones,
 # It may be a holiday (non-working day) in one country but not in the other and vice versa.  We can load the non-working day for both countries on this screen and visualize them on the board (if possible), but it impacts the Sprint Burndown, capacity planning and other aspects for the distributed team members.
 # We also received questions like which time zone shall be considered for starting and stopping the Iteration for e.g. if team is operating in Wednesday to Tuesday 10 days cycle,

Iteration Demos are being held in one time zone on Tuesday Evening and the other on Tuesday Morning.  So in one region the Iteration has technically ended, while other members have the rest of Tuesday before Iteration will end.

 

We've searched around for options to solve this problem but haven't had much luck aside from some unanswered community questions: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-can-we-manage-a-sprint-board-across-multiple-timezones/qaq-p/200006]
fields.summary: Board Support for Multiple Time Zones

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Some of our users would like the "Split Issue" right-click option from a Scrum backlog to copy over all the parent issue's fields over to the split issues, as they always end up re-setting all these fields again for the new split issues.
fields.summary: Make "Split Issue" copy over fields as well

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We would like the ability to control who has access to create/edit versions within a project. It appears the only way to currently do this is to grant the user project administrator permissions.

A way to control this in the permission schemes would work well.
fields.summary: Add granular permissions relating to version control

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding the name of the issue when creating issues through the backlog, the cursor moves to the end of the text. This causes text to be added at the end of the line instead of where intended. This happens on IE 11.

h3. Environment

Reproduced in both Jira 7.11.2 and Jira 7.12.3
IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Access to the backlog and sprint.
 # Create a new issue.
 # Add text to the issue.
 # When text is added, click where you want to add the cursor on and add more text and press space.
 
h3. Expected Results

When adding the text, it'll be added where clicked and where the cursor is.

h3. Actual Results

The text is added at the end of the line (See video for more details). 

 [^IE11_bug.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

None so far. Even using keyboard arrows do not work and when editing the line character gets added but then cursor gets moved to the end of the line again.
fields.summary: Cursor inconsistency when creating issue through backlog on IE11

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I want to be able to minimize the panel on the dashboard to be able to view the page in full mode!
fields.summary: Collapsible Dashboard Sidebar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, Kindly note that currently velocity chart is being generated for a project showing committed vs completed story points for all its sprints. However if there are multiple scrum teams in that project each executing its own sprints, this chart doesn't give a correct picture. It is not possible to view or track velocity per scrum team using this chart.

Could you please explore the possibility of a drop down for selection of scrum team in this velocity chart? This will avoid lot of manual effort in tracking scrum team wise velocity. 

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Display of Velocity Report per scrum team

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi, 

Kindly note that, in the backlog view, when we select a version and then an epic, issue 'summary' field if too long would not fit and automatically gets truncated. A user has to either use a tool tip or select a particular issue type to view its summary in full text. But if we have several issues in that view, it becomes difficult to understand summary of all in one go. Can we not have a feature of wrapping up of the text if the summary field is too long instead of truncating it? Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Visibility of full text of Issuetype Summary in the backlog view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Jira Agile Server REST API Reference documentation has the latest available version as 7.3.1  https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/7.3.1/
see also https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/latest currently redirects to that version

However Jira 7.3.x has already reached end of life for support per our [Atlassian Support End of Life Policy - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-support-end-of-life-policy-201851003.html].   As such, there are no currently supported Jira Software versions that accurately document the REST API endpoints that are available to use with Jira Agile/Software.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please update the available documentation to cite/reference a supported version of Jira Software, such as 7.13.x (an enterprise release version) or even the latest 8.0.2

h3. Why this is important
Without current documentation, it makes it very difficult for plugin developers, administrators, creators of integrations of our products, etc to accurate interface with our products.   It might not be feasible to release this documentation for every minor version release, but ideally we should be publishing updates for these for major version releases and enterprise releases
fields.summary: Update Jira Software REST API documentation to reference a current supported version

h3. Summary
Issue link "Search for an issue" does not work from Backlog and Active Sprints view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the backlog or Active sprints view;
# At the issue details on the right frame, click on "..." > Link > "Search for an issue"
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 16.37.36.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Have the "Search for an issue" window opened.
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 16.56.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
* Nothing happens.

h3.Solution / Workaround
* Use the issue view (http://jira_server/browse/ISSUE-KEY), click on "More" > Link > "Search for an issue".
fields.summary: Issue link "Search for an issue" does not work from Backlog and Active Sprints view.

fields.description:
When a user sends an email to Jira it would be useful to have the ability for a Jira Administrator be able to send an email back to the user to confirm there email is real and not a bot or something unwanted. It should then not create any tickets until this process is completed confirming the email is approved.

It could be automated or not or even have both.
fields.summary: The ability to have Jira verify email requests for the first time.

fields.description: It would be helpful if you have move to top button beside ticket in backlog. It can be a problem and a waste of time to drag several tickets, one by one, to the top of a backlog. Move to top button would sort that out. Or maybe add to sprint (from backlog).
fields.summary: Sprint board - Backlog - move to top button

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hey there,

in our company, we use Jira as an issue tracking tool for support and projects and a third party tool to track our time.

I wrote an interface that is based on Jira Webhooks.

As a new feature, I want to also send some information regarding the epic of the story (if present). Sadly in the webook data the epic is just there as customfield with just the epic's key as value - no further information about the epic itself.

*It would be great if the information about the epic would be prefetched for webhooks / if the epic wouldn't be a* customfield *at all* (as it seems to be the case with Jira Cloud.

All the best

Korbinian
fields.summary: Webhook: Epic Link not expanded

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using the wallboard slideshow feature, when wallboard has more than one gadget the application doesn't respect the gadgets display order.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create 3 dashboards as follows:
# Dashboard 1 has one gadget.
# Dashboard 2 has one gadget.
# Dashboard 3 has three gadgets.

(i) The first gadget in Dashboard 3 is a custom web page with the same settings and URL as the only gadget in Dashboard 2. Because of this, the slideshow actually works like this:

- Dashboard 1's gadget for 5 seconds.
- Dashboard 2's gadget for 5 seconds.
- Dashboard 3's second gadget for 5 seconds.
- Dashboard 1's gadget for 5 seconds.
- Dashboard 2's gadget for 5 seconds.
- Dashboard 3's third gadget for 5 seconds.
(repeating from here on)

The first gadget on Dashboard 3 seems to be skipped as it is a duplicate of Dashboard 2's gadget. 

h3. Expected Results

The expected outcome would instead be a cycle of:
Dashboard 1's gadget for 5 seconds.
Dashboard 2's gadget for 5 seconds.
Dashboard 3's second gadget for 5 seconds.
Dashboard 3's third gadget for 5 seconds.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wallboard slideshow doesn't respect the gadgets order

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
By default, when multiple Kanban quick filters are selected, the intersection of the query result sets is shown.  For some filters, it makes more sense to display the union of the result sets. For example, if I have multiple quick filters that filter based on component, it would be nice for those filters to be combined as an OR rather than an AND.  

How this could work in practice, would be for the board owner to to be able to define (sub-) groups of quick filters, and whether or not the groups should return unions or intersections.  An alternative approach could be to support some kind of generic quick filter that supports multi-select on particular ticket fields.
fields.summary: Ability to view union of Kanban quick filters

fields.description:
We want to use for Adaptavist ScriptRunner on JIRA Server v7.12.1. and we could not upload by using UPM, So we added plugin manually to jira.home/plugins/installed-plugins/ and restarted JIRA. After that, Plugins could not enabled automatically then we thougtht because there is no trial or commercial licence. Then we got a trial licence and paste licence usign addon licence key management. Licence key accepted, but plugin not enabled yet. Then we tried to uninstall plugin by using UPM, also failed. Later, we upgrade upm to latest version and tried above, failed again.

 

This behavior occurs in every addon installation and gives an error “An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information.” But there is no log in the log file. We could not survive this, Could you show us a way to handle this?
fields.summary: "An unexpected error occurred. Refer to the logs for more information." on UPM

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our Business Case; I am sure there are others:
 * we have a product development Jira project. It contains various products and different customers who will get the features.
 * we want a particular customer to be able to see the status and progress of his issues. Therefore, we synch these issues one way to another Jira project - it is considered read/only.

Whenever we synch comments, their @mentions are notified upon save of the comment copy. Since the @mentioned people have been notified upon creation of the original comment, the additional notification serves just one purpose - it confuses the notified people.

 

Therefore, I ask for a per-project configurable @mention notification - much like all other notifications in a project.
fields.summary: Make @mention notifications configurable per JIRA project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I did a few searches to see if this came up but didn't find anything that quite matched.

Currently, in the Jira Server Release Hub, the calculation of progress toward version completion is done using issue count. There is no option to use story points or hours instead. While one can use the Version Report instead, which does use Story Points as the default measure, or Portfolio, it would be nice to make the progress tracker in the Release Hub configurable, so that users can choose whether or not progress is tracked by issue count, story points, or hours. This simple change would provide a lot of teams with a highly accurate and easy-to-consume view of progress toward version completion for management. Allowing this configuration would also make the Jira Roadmap gadget for dashboards more accurate.

Certain add-ons allow tracking to be counted in all 3 of these options and provide an alternative tracking view, usually at the Epic level. It would be really nice if Jira offered this capability out of the box. The progress tracker is a really useful view and nicely laid out, providing a quick visual snapshot of progress toward completion of a version. However, limiting it to only the issue count can cause a bloated count for teams that assign a fixVersion both to Epics and Stories, and can also be problematic if/when teams have to assign fixVersions to sub-tasks. Both of those cases cause bloated issue counts, since grandparent and parent issues are included in the count as well as children and grandchildren.
fields.summary: Release Hub: Users can configure release hub progress view to use issue count, story points, or hours

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing Version and licensing page return 500 error with NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/http/impl/auth/BasicScheme

h3. Environment
 * JIRA 8.0.0, JIRA 8.0.1 with a forward proxy to access Marketplace.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a forward proxy in setenv.sh (Linux) or setenv.bat (Windows) following [How to Configure an Outbound HTTP and HTTPS Proxy for JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-an-outbound-http-and-https-proxy-for-jira-applications-247857187.html].
{code}
-Dhttp.proxyHost=proxy.example.org -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080 -Dhttps.proxyHost=proxy.example.org -Dhttps.proxyPort=8080 -Dhttp.proxyUser=proxyuser -Dhttp.proxyPassword=proxypassword -Dhttps.proxyUser=proxyuser -Dhttps.proxyPassword=proxypassword -Dhttp.nonProxyHosts=localhost
{code}
# Restart JIRA for it to take effect.
# After restart go to ⚙>Application to access Versions and Licensing page.

h3. Expected Results
Versions and Licensing page load properly.

h3. Actual Results
Versions and Licensing page return 500 error with below error:
{code}
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ExecutionError: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/http/impl/auth/BasicScheme
com.google.common.util.concurrent.ExecutionError: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/http/impl/auth/BasicScheme
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2048) [guava-26.0-jre.jar:?]
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3952) [guava-26.0-jre.jar:?]
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4871) [guava-26.0-jre.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:178) [atlassian-cache-memory-4.0.0.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.cache.memory.DelegatingCache.get(DelegatingCache.java:163) [atlassian-cache-memory-4.0.0.jar:?]
	at com.atlassian.upm.application.marketplace.ApplicationMarketplaceQueriesImpl.getPlatformVersionInfo(ApplicationMarketplaceQueriesImpl.java:130) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.upm.application.marketplace.ApplicationMarketplaceQueriesImpl.getAvailableAppsInfo(ApplicationMarketplaceQueriesImpl.java:144) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.upm.application.servlet.ApplicationManagerHandler.getContext(ApplicationManagerHandler.java:105) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.upm.core.servlet.UpmServletHandler.handle(UpmServletHandler.java:91) [?:?]
	at com.atlassian.upm.core.servlet.UpmServletHandler.handle(UpmServletHandler.java:62) [?:?]
{code}
h3. Workaround
The error happen due to the *{{-Dhttps.proxyUser=proxyuser}}* and *{{-Dhttps.proxyPassword=proxypassword}}* setting on the forward proxy. As a workaround, removing the settings will resolve the issue.
{code}
-Dhttp.proxyHost=proxy.example.org -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080 -Dhttps.proxyHost=proxy.example.org -Dhttps.proxyPort=8080 -Dhttp.proxyUser=proxyuser -Dhttp.proxyPassword=proxypassword -Dhttp.nonProxyHosts=localhost
{code}
fields.summary: Accessing Version and licensing page return 500 error with NoClassDefFoundError: org/apache/http/impl/auth/BasicScheme

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the column constraint counts both, the story and its sub-tasks, resulting in additional count, which is superfluous in that case.

We need to include sub-tasks only for the column constraint. The story is just a container for sub tasks. Sub-tasks are the actual measure of work.

Generally, the constraint count should be calculated as:
* count all main (parent) tasks, which have no sub-tasks
* if an issue has sub-tasks (e.g. story), count the sub-tasks only

E.g., a story without sub-tasks would be counted as 1. When adding a sub-task to it, count would still remain 1.
fields.summary: Kanban board: Column constraints count parent and sub-tasks twice

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Moving issues with assigned epic across kanban backlog and divided kanban backlog area is throwing a javascript error. Problem occurs on kanplan, I couldn't reproduce it on scrum backlog. After first occurrence an error will be thrown for each drag & drop. The core functionality of dragging issues works but the usability of it is pretty low and may have side effects.
h3. Environment
 * macOS Mojave 10.14
 * Google Chrome 72

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a kanban project
 # [Enable kanplan|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-4-x-release-notes-902079634.html#JIRASoftware7.4.xreleasenotes-IntroducingtheKanbanbacklog]
 # Get a backlog of variety issues (with and without epic).
 # Try to move an issue with assigned epic to divided kanban backlog area
 # After D&D javascript error will throw

h3. Expected Results

Moving issues across kanban backlog works without errors. 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown:
{noformat}
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'text' of undefined
{noformat}

h3. Notes
It works properly on 7.13.x

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Moving issues across kanban backlog throws an error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, there's no way to change the length limit of a text field to show in a card. If you add two fields in the card layout and one of them has a large text, it can shorten the other field, e.g. the description field making the status field unreadable because it gets shortened.

The solution would be to implement a way to change the max limit of characters in a field.
fields.summary: Change text field length to show in card(board)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding a text field (like description) with a lot of text to the card layout on backlog view, the view becomes distorted with field data overlapping each other.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 8.0.0 
* Cannot reproduce in Jira 7.13

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Add Description field to Card Layout on backlog view. If the description is long, the backlog becomes distorted and it's hard to read through.

h3. Expected Results
Text is rendered properly without issue.

 !Jira713.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Text is not rendered or wrapped up properly causing everything to be mixed up.

 !Jira800.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 # Login as a Jira system administrator.
 # Click *!https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/files/861252910/861252911/1/1481429395295/cog.png|width=30! >* *Issues*
 # On the left panel of the administration screen click on *Priorities*
 # On the *Priorities* list click on *Edit* next to one of the affected priorities

(!) If it has a different *icon URL* in comparison to the other priorities, please edit this as per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0814/defining-priority-field-values-1043893666.html] and make sure that all of them use the same path.
fields.summary: Backlog view on board becomes distorted when adding a text field to the card layout

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I have multiple dashboards and some widgets need to have more (horicontal) space than others.  The current layouts are too restricted as they only offer misc horizontal partitions. As I know the problems of layouting, the follwong layout should be easy to implement:

The upper boxes/widgets can occupy the full width - no matter how many. The lower boxes/widgets could use one of the already existing layouts (<n> columns).

This would allow to add widgets with wider horizontal space requirements to add as top widgets, while the widgets with narrow horizontal space can be added below in on of the columns:

############################################

############################################

############################################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

#############  #############  ################

 

Yeah?
fields.summary: New dashboard layout: columns below lists

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So far, you can only log working hours on a main task. If you have multiple subtasks each with different assignes (developers) each log their own work hours. BUt as you can only log them on the main task, there is no way to have a sprint plan with real work hours for each user which makes it hard to plan human ressources for a sprint.

If each subtask would be able to have their own estimated and logged work, a sprint overview (backlog sprint list) could show the real planned / estimated time (and therefore ressource occupation) and the logged work could better be assigned to each developer.
fields.summary: Allow "Estimated time" / "Log Work" for Subtasks

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If you have more than 1 dashboard, all dashboard names are listet ont he left - in addition to the already existing Dashboards menu. This{color:#de350b} takes up space{color} that is much more valuable in the dashboard itself.

If I remove all dashboards except 1 from my "favorite" dashboards, the panel on the left vanishes. But then, the Dashboards menu also does not show my other dashboards.

Suggestions:

* make the dashboard selection panel {color:#00875a}hideable{color} (either by configuration or by little arrow to collapse the panel)
* in the Dashboards menu, show all of "{color:#00875a}My{color}" dashboards - not only the "{color:#de350b}favorite{color}" dashboards.
fields.summary: Dashboards: make dashboard list hideable / show "My" dashboards in Dashboards menu

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no option to create Release Notes templates for specific projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow administrators to customize Release Notes templates per project.

h3. Why this is important
Customers have a variety of different teams using the same instance, performing different tasks on their projects. Between these teams, each will have its own needs and requirements in terms of publishing the release. Having the option to configure release notes per project will allow further customization of this feature based on each project's needs.
fields.summary: Allow the customization of Release Templates by project

We have a request to have swimlanes based on Sprints

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As the agile component of Jira with Scrum and Kanban boards is more and more getting the core product for our Jira instances I am confused why there is still no good API to access the formerly called Rapid Views. 

The following information is requested to be added in [BoardData|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/8.0.0/com/atlassian/jira/board/model/BoardData.html]
* board type (scrum/kanban)
* board name 
* estimation 
* associated projects (see https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest#api-rest-agile-1-0-board-boardId-project-get)
* quick filters (see https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest#api-rest-agile-1-0-board-boardId-quickfilter-get)
* swimlanes
* filter (currently only the JQL string is available)
* ranking (see https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest#api-rest-agile-1-0-board-boardId-configuration-get)

h3. Notes
* Raised in Atlassian Community https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Resolve-projects-in-agile-board-from-Jira-Software-Server-inside/qaq-p/973672

h3. Workaround
The information can be accessed via REST API
fields.summary: Be able to access Board details using Java API

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be nice when releasing a version that all the info from all branches created from issues would be pulled into the release notes from BB.
fields.summary: view  information related to branches created from the issues, commits, pull requests in the release notes

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
My group likes the Atlassian products.  We use Jira, Confluence and BitBucket.  We have been using Jira for years.  We are not power users of Jira, but would like to stay with Jira.  However, with the increasing renewal pricing, I have been asked to strongly consider another provider.

I understand Jira has way more functionality than we use.  It would be great if you could keep the packages affordable.

 

Thank you,
fields.summary: Rising Jira renewal pricing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Definition
Currently, there's no way to modify the content-security-policy header besides:
* the default value that Atlassian has set {{frame-ancestors 'self'}}
* or to exempt certain pages or disabling the protection entirely.
See https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/security-headers-in-jira-939919914.html/. 

However, there is no way to provide a different configuration for that header. For example a user may prefer to have:
{code}frame-ancestors 'self' https://trusteddomain.com{code} 
This will allow users to exempt applink URLs for instance from these checks as trusted domains. Useful for embedding gadgets, pages etc from one Atlassian Application to the other. 

h3. Suggestion
Provide more configuration options for this header. Atleast provide a way to specify trusted domains from where the Jira web page can be framed.

h3. Workaround
Use a web-server like Apache, Nginx etc as a reverse proxy and then use the header re-write features of the proxy to add these headers.
fields.summary: Implement Configuration Option for CSP Header

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Definition
When the user creates some sub-branches, it is quite hard to keep track of all of it unless they explicitly follow some format. In any case, it would be great if we can query this information via issue navigator to easily retrieve the information.

h3. Suggestion
To implement a JQL in JIRA to retrieve the branches associated to pull requests.
fields.summary: JQL to retrieve Branches associated to a Pull Request

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to add Custom Fields to the displayed Columns of the Section "Issues in Epic" within the standard Issue Type "Epic".
fields.summary: Customize columns of Issues in Epics

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
By default a user will see Kanban board's column names in his/her user profile language. However, after Kanban backlog is enabled, the columns will be displayed in the user profile language of the board creator at the time when the board was created.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Set system language to French
# As a user with English profile language, create a new Kanban board for a new Kanban project
#* This board will have 4 columns: BACKLOG, SELECTED FOR DEVELOPMENT, IN PROGRESS, DONE
# Log in as a user with German profile language and view the board
#* The columns are displayed as: BACKLOG, ZUR ENTWICKLUNG AUSGEWÄHLT, WIRD AUSGEFÜHRT, FERTIG (/)
# Configure the board and enable Kanban backlog

h3. Expected behavior
The user with German profile language should still see the other columns in German (BACKLOG is now moved to Kanban backlog).

h3. Actual behavior
The user with German profile language now sees the columns in English (-)

h3. Notes
# All user profile languages are affected
# Disabling Kanban backlog doesn't revert the translations
# Even if the board creator changes user profile language to a different one e.g. Dutch, the columns are still displayed in English for all users

h3. Workaround
None at the moment. The ticket will be updated in case one is available.
fields.summary: Enabling Kanban backlog breaks Kanban board's Column translations

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when a user create a Epic issue, following warning will be shown in screen:

{quote}
An epic cannot have another epic linked to it.
{quote}

Some users would like option to hide this because Epic Link cannot be used with Epic itself.


h3. Suggested Solution

Hide Epic Link field from Epic's create screen.


h3. Workaround 

Unlock Epic Link field by following steps from [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-jira-software-field-779158866.html] KB and change the "Choose applicable issue types" to exclude Epic.

(!) Do note that this could cause possibly some other problem.
fields.summary: Hide Epic Link from Epic screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When more than one translated statuses are mapped into the same column, and then user tries to transition an issue to that column, the statuses will be shown in English instead of the translated language

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 statuses (or any number more than one) mapped to the same column. 
#* Lets say status In Progress and Done mapped to Done column
# Change language setting to other language (lets say German)
# Drag issue from other column to Done column

h3. Expected Results
JIRA will show options of statuses in that column in the translated language (so in case of German, it should show IN ARBEIT and FERTIG)

h3. Actual Results
It shows statuses in English (in this case, In Progress and Done). Even though the column management page itself shows the status in the translated language.

(i) It's reproducible in Scrum and Kanban boards, with several languages like German, French, etc.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mapping more than one status in the same column breaks statuses' translation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira allows dashboards to be made public and shared with anonymous users by setting the right permissions. This work great for many gadgets. However, when adding a Sprint Burndown gadget it does not show on the dashboard appearing as blank. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard and share it with public
 # In an agile project, create a board and make sure that the filter sharing is set to public
 # Create a sprint if there is none in the project.
 # Make sure to add 'Anyone' group to the 'Browse Project' permission
 # Add a Sprint Burndown Gadget to the Dashboard after selecting the above sprint
 # Try to view the shared dashboard with an anonymous user.

h3. Expected Results

The Sprint Burndown gadget will be displayed 
h3. Actual Results

The Burndown Gadet is not displayed.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to make Sprint Burndown Dashboard gadget public

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
One of the great features of Kanban boards is the ability to use a filter as the base, and apply sub-filter criteria.  It would be great to have similar functionality available for filters more generally.

 

This is particularly desirable for us as we have several standard dashboards that we use that have similar filters, but each one must be unique because it is associated to a specific individual.  For instance, a single dashboard has about 6 filters:
 * Overdue Issues: Josh Meier
 * Current Work: Josh Meier
 * Resolved last 20 Days: Josh Meier
 * Waiting: Josh Meier
 * ...

We have a dashboard with this set of filters for every employee in our 25 person office.  Whenever we need to change how one of these filters works (either due to field changes or other reasons), it's a substantial undertaking to make the tweak.  If they could all be based on a single base filter, that would save substantial time.

I see some overlap with existing suggestion: JRASERVER-25833
fields.summary: Create infrastructure to allow sub-filters

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Ability to clone an issue without cloning Agile sprint information

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira allows epic names to be created with special characters such as comma ' , '  semicolon ' ; ' etc. In the epic link field, when a user enters an epic name, Jira autocomplete feature returns suggestions as the user types. However, it is noticed that the autocomplete behavior is not consistent when the epic name contains a comma. That is, Jira also includes issues that do not have comma and does not deal with the comma as a part of the name.

This can be inconvenient when there is a large number of epics created with a similar name that contains a comma as it will include unnecessary values.

Please refer to the attached screenshots to further illustrate this:

!epicLink_comma.png|thumbnail!

!epicLink_semicolon.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a number of epics which where some has a comma and some don't
 # Open an issue and search start typing the epic names which has comma.

h3. Expected Results

Jira will filter the results correctly and will respect the comma in the epic names similar to other characters.
h3. Actual Results

Jira shows epics which also does not have comma as well.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Epic Link field does not correctly filter epic names with comma

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Would be great if we could upgrade "Issues in this epic" view by adding new useful columns like "component"/"priority" etc.
fields.summary: Make possible to add other columns to "Issues in this epic" view

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Jira only logs failures when copying attachments from the node-local home to the shared home for a DC instance. When troubleshooting missing attachments, it would be very helpful to have logging available at DEBUG level noting successful copies.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a logging message at DEBUG capturing when a file is successfully copied between the local and shared homes.
fields.summary: Add logging for successful attachment copy operation from local home to shared home in DC

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Kanban board -> Reports -> Control Chart user, I would like to have options to automatically exclude outliers outside of some levels of standard deviations, so that I can see what the Cycle Time numbers are without having to use exclusion labels and quick-filters.

It would be nice-to-have if it could support exclusion of multiple levels of deviation - e.g. exclude data points outside 2 deviations, but within one. 

Not to get into how to do this, but perhaps check-boxes might work for quick ease of use, similar to the "Include non-working days" box.

Another nice to have would be the standard deviation as calculated against all teh data points be included in the mean, median, row of numbers. I do not believe the exiting swath and hover number is correct.
fields.summary: Report - Control Chart - option to automatically exclude outliers outside level of standard deviation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: The Layout of the Dachboard is very limited in Design for the time. For Stand-ups it would be better if you are more free in Design of the Dashboards. Like size of the Gadgets.
fields.summary: Gadget size and Design of Dashboard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With Relative date/time enabled (default), a custom field of type Date Time Picker:
# Displays relative values on JIRA View Issue screen
# Displays absolute values on JIRA Agile's Issue Detail View

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type Date Time Picker
# Add the field to Create/Edit/View screen of an issue and give it a value that can be displayed relatively (yesterday, tomorrow, etc.)
# Configure an Agile board where the issue is available and add the field to Issue Detail View

h3. Expected Results
The field shows Relative values on both View Issue screen and Agile board.

h3. Actual Results
The field shows Relative value on View Issue screen but Absolute value on Agile board:
!datetime.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
# This doesn't affect custom field of type Date Picker. Date Picker always shows Absolute values, similar to Due Date.
# This affects both Scrum and Kanban boards.

h3. Workaround
If possible, disable Relative date/time following this KB:
* [Disable relative dates in JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html]

All the fields will display Absolute values.
fields.summary: Custom Date Time Picker field displays Relative and Absolute values inconsistently

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Full issue dialog pops up at inline issue create button on Backlog if quick filter is selected and the filter includes AND operator for checkboxes.
 Issue should be created inline instead of full dialog because such filter is valid to specify an issue type.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create custom field "TestCheckBox" with field type CheckBox and add "option A", "option B" for its option.
 # Add the custom field on your own issue type
 # Head to Backlog screen on your project and add Quick Filter with following condition –
 {{TestCheckBox = "option A" AND TestCheckBox = "option B"}}
 # Select the quick filter in the Backlog screen
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-18 at 16.37.37.png|thumbnail!
 # Hit "Create Issue" in the Backlog screen

h3. Expected Results

Issue that has value "option A" and "option B" is created without showing full dialog.
h3. Actual Results

It navigates you a full dialog.
 !image-2019-02-21-11-26-57-972.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

If you configured

{{TestCheckBox = "option A"}}

in your quick filter, the dialog will not pop up.
h3. Workaround

Create an issue with full dialog.
fields.summary: Inline issue create with quick filter that has AND operator for Checkbox navigate full issue dialog instead of quick issue creation

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary Clicking on some Project Reports link in Internet Explorer will result in error 400 broken link. h3. Environment - Jira 7.13.0 - IE 11 h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create multi-byte name project (ex. テストプロジェクト) # Access JIRA with Internet Explorer 11 # Access _Project > Reports_ # Click following reports -- Average Age Report -- Created vs. Resolved Issues Report -- Pie Chart Report -- Recently Created Issues Report -- Resolution Time Report -- Single Level Group By Report -- Time Since Issues Report -- Time Tracking Report -- User Workload Report -- Version Workload Report h3. Expected Results Link is opened successfully h3. Actual Results Internet Explorer shows "HTTP 400 bad request" error. h3. Notes The request fails due to the "Pie Chart Report" link being unencoded, ie. {code:java} Pie Chart Report{code} Other browsers able to encode the URL on their own when user click the link. {code:java} Referer: http://localhost:8080/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10100&projectOrFilterId=project-10100&projectOrFilterName=%E3%83%86%E3%82%B9%E3%83%88%E3%83%97%E3%83%AD%E3%82%B8%E3%82%A7%E3%82%AF%E3%83%88&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.jira-core-reports-plugin:recentlycreated-report{code} h3. Workaround # Use other browser such as Google Chrome # Encode multibyte text manually and access the URL
fields.summary: Some "Project Repots" link does not work on IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Drag and Drop ZIP non-image file from the board to Desktop does not work on Firefox and Internet Explorer as per [JRASERVER-60728|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-60728]. However, on Google Chrome, this feature only works on the first try, consecutive try will throw an error.

h3. Environment
* Google Chrome Version 71.0.3578.98

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an issue with a non-image file attached (i.e a word document)
# Click document and drag to desktop

h3. Expected Results
The file should be copied to the desktop.

h3. Actual Results
The file is not allowed to be copied to the desktop. There is a pop-up:
!error.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Refresh the page to drag and drop the file.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop ZIP file from board to Desktop failing after first try

fields.summary: Viewing historical data in issue navigator similar to sprint report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be nice to show display names for disabled directories if the user has an entry in cwd_user. 

h2. Use Case:

* JIRA has AD directory added 
* New directory is added that some inactive users aren't in 
* old directory is disabled
* for historical record keeping jira will only display the lower_username in app_user
* There is still an inactive record in app_user, why not show this info?

h2. . Workaround:
Migrate the inactive users from the disabled directory to the JIRA internal directory making sure to not bring users that are active in another directory:
 (!) This will require direct DB manipulation and a restart of JIRA
* stop JIRA
* backup the db or the cwd_user table 
* run the following command
{code:java}
update cwd_user set directory_id=1 where directoy_id=<idofldapdisabled> AND active=0; {code}
* start JIRA
fields.summary: display name not shown for disabled directories

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

As many companies (including my organisation) uses a MDM-Solution do distribute Apps to managed devices within the organisation, it would help the employee a lot if we could pre-configure the server url.

*Suggested solution:*

Add Server URL as a minimum to AppConfig so that it can be pre-configured through a MDM Solution. See this site for reference: [https://www.appconfig.org/ios/]
fields.summary: Add appconfig to Jira Server iOS Mobile App

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Language packs show version 8.1 while the file indicates 8.0

h3. Environment
* Jira 8.0.0, 
* ZIP installer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download and extract Jira Software 8.0.0
# Start Jira
# Look at the logs or at the application.xml
# Compare the names of the language packs vs the files at <JIRA Installation>/atlassian-jira\WEB-INF\atlassian-bundled-plugins

h3. Expected Results
The versions on the file names match the version displayed in Jira logs and application.xml.

h3. Actual Results
The versions of the files and the names reflected in the logs are different. For example:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
This also happens with Jira Core 8.0.0 language packs

h3. Workaround
Not needed, as it doesn't affect functionality.
fields.summary: Language packs show version 8.1 while the file indicates 8.0

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Jira, the "_Hide Epic Labels_"/"_Show Epic Labels_" option is missing from the _Board_ drop down in the kanban backlog view, even though it's available on kanban boards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Enable the Kanban Backlog on a project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver0713/configuring-columns-965542312.html#Configuringcolumns-enablingkanbanbacklog]
 # Navigate to a kanban backlog view
 # Open the _Board_ dropdown

h3. Expected Results

"Hide Epic Labels" or "Show Epic Labels" is present
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-13 at 3.43.48 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The option is missing
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-13 at 3.43.19 PM.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Workaround

It's possible to switch to the board view, change settings, and then toggle back to the backlog view.
The same settings will apply to both locations.
fields.summary: "Hide Epic Labels" /  "Show Epic Labels" on Kanban Backlog missing

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If different context is defined for the Flagged Custom Field, Jira Agile board action "Flag" doesn't work.

It doesn't work for the projects inside the new context only. For projects on the default context Flagging works fine.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Go to Custom Fields: <instance>/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
# Click on configure for field Flagged
# Add new Context and add it for just one agile project.
# Go to that project's board
# right click on an issue and select 'Add a Flag'

- Expected: Issue is flagged
- Result: Error shown
!flagged.jpeg!

This configuration would be useful to flag issues when created for a group of projects and easily distinguish them on the board.

h4. Workaround: 

Avoid creating additional configuration context for Flagged field and reserve only one configuration context for the field for now.
fields.summary: Context Flagged custom field causes error when Flagging issue on Board

When printing story cards “impediment” status is placed on the same spot as priority. This is bad when we do sprint planning based on priority because don’t know which priority it is.

 

There is plenty of space on the card and can we somehow show both the priority and flag in while printing cards.
fields.summary: Impediment flag hiding priority field on story card

fields.summary: Allow more than 3 fields on card layout

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be great to have the possibility to create a single loop transition that would be applicable to all statuses of the workflow without needing to recreate/reuse it on each status.

Example:

Suppose you have a very simple workflow with the classic states and transitions:

   TODO ---> INPROGRESS ----> DONE

  For EACH of the three states, I want to have another Loop Transition with the same name (let's name it "Change number"). Every time the user clicks on it, a simple screen must be shown, with a single number field on it named "Total number of blocks", and the user must update this info. So, I'll have some validators that check if the number was changed and after that, I have also some other post-functions that change other custom fields in this issue, based in this value that was updated by the user. 

This SAME Loop transition, with the same name, the same screen, the same validator, and the same post-functions MUST be implemented for ALL three status of the workflow. You will clearly notice that it takes three times the same efforts to produce it.

What I'm looking for is: I want to create some "special configurable" transition, that is created ONLY ONCE, with its screens, validators, and post-functions, but JIRA is wise enough to understand that this Loop Transition is valid (and available) for ALL the three states TODO, INPROGRESS and DONE.
fields.summary: Create a single loop transition applicable to every statuses

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi Atlassians,

I wanted to suggest, that non-Atlassians can report Bugs as well. Apparently only Atlassian staff can create Bug tickets here, which is super confusing, because when I find a bug in Jira and want to report it, I can fill out all the fields, click create and get an error message, that says, I don't have the Assign Issues permission.

Thanks
fields.summary: Option to report Bugs

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi there,

currently it is possible to order Scrum and Kanban boards by custom fields other than Rank.

If I order the board with anything else, though, I can't create Sprints or schedule Tasks to Sprints at all. That I can't use the Drag&Drop functionality I can understand, but that the whole sprint planning is disabled makes the whole board completely useless.

Especially in a scaled environment like SAFe where I use different indicators like a WSJF customfield I need the ordering on this custom field and still be able to create sprints and schedule items.

Same goes for the Kanban Backlog. If I have a list of Features on a Program level in a Kanban board I can't order these by WSJF indicator without losing the schedule possibility. On Kanban I can't use the backlog functionality any more and the scrum boards are completely useless like this.

It is really difficult to explain to customers why such a basic feature is not implemented without losing the whole userfriendlyness.

Please make it possible to create sprints even if the board is not ordered by rank.
fields.summary: Possibility to create Sprints if ranking is disabled

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is JS exception while moving issue on backlog view (from active sprint to backlog)

_Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of null_
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to backlog view
 # Drag & Drop issue from active sprint to backlog
 # Confirm pop-up about sprint scope change
 # JS error occurs on the screen (not 100% reproducible)

h3. Expected Results

No JS Exception
h3. Actual Results

JS Exception visible on the screen
{noformat}
TypeError: Cannot read property '0' of nullat Array. (https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/s/236e2afa13c2b014cfb50738628d54ea-CDN/4dcwdm/800007/79e0848d9d30472750fbd0eef0ac90f7/10cfe1b37e8306c7a7366c409b73c8ea/_/download/contextbatch/js/gh-rapid-work,jira.project.sidebar,atl.general,jira.general,jira.global,com.atlassian.jira.projects.sidebar.init,greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,-_super/batch.js?agile_global_admin_condition=true&baseurl-check-resources=true&hc-enabled=true&healthcheck-resources=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&locale=en-US&whisper-enabled=true:3617:1096)at c (https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/s/85fe00b48c662e469eb017623b4c87c7-CDN/4dcwdm/800007/79e0848d9d30472750fbd0eef0ac90f7/bfbcaa85c5e2041247e0b5f2890ae185/_/download/contextbatch/js/_super/batch.js?locale=en-US:65:22895)at project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if the JQL function allow parameters more flexible. For example, current 'linkedIssues()' only support issue key, or key and linktype. it is very much helpful to implement fields condition or etc like 'linkedIssues( XXX field = VVV)'. It makes users achieve more flexible and strong searching.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I want to be able to run the following query:

_*project = THEPROJECTNAME AND description changed AFTER startOfWeek()*_ however it says; "_History searches do not support the 'description' field._"

Our Business Analysis / Product Owner teams are using Jira to write their requierements and analysis' to for documentation purpose and the document reviewers need to review outputs of the team members. Such a query would be so useful not to miss any Jira issue that has an update only on description field.

!image-2019-02-07-15-24-00-241.png!
fields.summary: The update of description field is not trackable by date

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues are listed as scope change when they are added before the start of sprint

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.8.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sprint
# Create an issue
# Add the issue to sprint
# Click on 'Start Sprint'
#* The steps 3 and 4 four should happen on same minute. e.g: 12:00 PM
# Click on 'Start'
#* This should happen 1 minute after you click on 'Start Sprint'. e.g: 12:01 PM

h3. Expected Results
Issue should be listed as sprint scope one its started

h3. Actual Results
Issue is listed as scope change
 
h3. Notes
* The issue is not reproduced if you add the issue to the sprint then wait a minute to start it.
* The issue can't be reproduced consistently.
fields.summary: Issues are listed as scope change when they are added before the start of sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: F

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently it is pretty common for us to create a Kanban Board that allows us to see all tickets that are with our team members and also with other teams.

It would be helpful to have the ability to create for the same Kanban Board different views for different profiles.

For instance: if I am the manager, I want to see what is with Dev Team, QA team or Business Team. So, my Kanban view has all columns for all statuses. I would like to be able to have a 'Development' view/profile, on which the columns that shows tickets with QA Team and with Business Team would not be displayed, showing the columns that are related to Dev Team bigger in the screen. Similarly, we might be able to select the 'QA' view/profile, on which only the columns related to tasks with QA team would be displayed.

Currently, the workaround for that is to create different Kanbans, but this means that in case we are updating the Swimlanes, Quick Filters, Card Colors, Card Layout or any other information, we need to manually cascade these changes to the other (duplicated) Kanbans.
fields.summary: Allow the configuration of different views/profiles for the same Kanban Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the only way to link issues to Epics via the CSV import is to map the "Epic Link" field to the issue key of the Epic.

That being the case, in order to import Epics and linked issues on the same CSV file, we need to manually set an "Issue Key" for the Epics, requiring us to know of a unique "Issue Key" that can be used and making it only possible to achieve this using the *External System Import* tool, only available to administrators.

It should be possible to either use the same principles available for linking issues - assigning an ID exclusive to that project and linking issues via that value; or allowing the linkage using "Epic Name".
fields.summary: Support the importing of "Epic Link" with "Epic Name"

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Delete My Account

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new Epic opening the creation page on a new tab and not specifying the required field 'Epic Name', Jira does not create the Epic and returns with an error that does not specify it's proper name, but it informs 'customfield_10104' instead.

h3. Environment
We've replicated this issue on all versions from Jira 7.0 up to Jira 7.13.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open the "Create" page on a new tab of the browser
 # Select 'Epic' issue type, and click to create the issue without specifying any information

h3. Expected Results
Returns an error message specifying the field's name like any other field, for example "Epic Name: Epic Name is required".

h3. Actual Results
It returns the error message "customfield_10104: Epic Name is required".

h3. Notes
Any other system or custom field returns with it's proper name before the description of the error.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating Epic in new window shows misleading validation error when epic name is not specified.  "customfield_10104: Epic Name is required".

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Product Owner, 

I would like to be able to deactivate a Team instead of removing it, 

such that the history of what the Team has done is saved, but the dropdown box with which an issue can be assigned to a Team (in Jira) does not show inactive teams. 

 

We have currently 7 active teams and one team that seized to be over a year ago. We would like to keep the list of Teams to chose from as small as possible without loosing the possibility to search for issues once solved by this inactive Team.
fields.summary: Deactivate (i.s.o remove) Team

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if an issue is created in JIRA, it'll automatically have the lowest rank value in JIRA. Some users would like the rank value of the newly created issue in JIRA (from Epic page) to be below Epic which the new issue is linked.

+Steps to reproduce the use case+

# Create a new issue within an Epic in JIRA.
# After switching to Portfolio plan and performing a recalculation, the new issue will be ranked just under the Epic (under Scope view).
# Access Issue Navigator and use the JQL filter with rank ordering (E.g. "assignee = Vicknesh ORDER BY Rank ASC") lists created issue on last rank position. We'll see that the newly created issue at the bottom.
# Going back to JIRA Portfolio and moving the issue manually one rank position up and one rank position down (this will trigger re-rank operation) will result in the orange "change line" + commit message.
# After committing the changes in JIRA Portfolio, the same JQL query below will now list the new issue below the Epic.


h3. Suggested Solution

When an issue is created from Epic issue page, make JIRA set the rank value to the value next to the Epic's rank value.


h3. Workaround 

Manually re-rank the issue from either board or Portfolio plan.
fields.summary: Alter ranking behaviour of issue created from Epic page

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Jira Cloud has the *Pages* functionality, in which users can quickly create and view pages created by their team. The feature is detailed here:
* [The new Pages feature in JIRA Software project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/the-new-pages-feature-in-jira-software-project-958770525.html/]

The current workaround in Jira Server or Data Center is to create *shortcuts*, but it does not provide all the functionality from the feature above such as linked pages for sprints.
fields.summary: As a user I want to create and view Confluence pages from the project page in Jira

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
JSWSERVER-10243 is apparently not totally solved. We have customer reports of the bug occurring again but we don't know what the trigger is. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a check to the integrity checker to verify if there are duplicate Epic-Story issue link types and delete the invalid ones. 
The steps can be found in the article: [Duplicate Epic-Story Link types in IssueLinkType table causing errors in search using has Epic|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/duplicate-epic-story-link-types-in-issuelinktype-table-causing-errors-in-search-using-has-epic-779158623.html].
h3. Workaround
Execute the steps in the article above.
fields.summary: Integrity checker should check for duplicate Epic-Story issue link types

So that I can find issues that was in a sprint but are no longer in that sprint

fields.summary: Support for history searches for the 'sprint' field

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, completed issues in a Sprint will only be shown in Active Sprint in backlog. Completed issues will be hidden from inactive Sprints.

Some board administrators would like backlog to show all issues including completed issues in all Sprints (including inactive Sprint).


h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option in board configuration for the board administrator to allow all issues including completed issue to be shown in backlog.


h3. Workaround 

If user is working with multiple Sprints, enable "Parallel Sprint" from JIRA Software configuration page.
fields.summary: Allow completed issues to be shown in all Sprints in backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center
